tasks.task: Operating and maintaining a gasification system for cow manure.
subtasks: Loading cow manure and bedding into the gasification unit.
Monitoring and adjusting the airflow to control oxygen levels.
Regulating the feed rates of raw material and biochar using variable frequency drives.
Controlling the moisture content of the input material.
Monitoring the temperature inside the gasifier.
Collecting and managing the biochar output.
Ensuring proper combustion in the thermal oxidizer.
Adjusting the energy output and heat applications based on customer needs.
Maintaining equipment such as the rotary dryer for drying manure and bedding.
Constituting emissions and particulate matter through controlled air supply.
Evaluating the nutrient content and quality of the biochar.
Adapting the system to process various manure types (e.g., swine and poultry) and adjust for differences in moisture and nutrient content.

tasks.task: Producing and utilizing biochar on a farm.
subtasks: Distributing biochar as a soil amendment or feed supplement.
Storing biochar until needed.
Introducing biochar into agricultural practices to improve soil health or provide nutrients.
Monitoring the impact of biochar on crop yields or animal feed.
Adapting biochar applications based on specific farm needs.

tasks.task: Managing manure barns and agricultural waste.
subtasks: Ensuring proper waste management practices on the farm.
Supervising the collection and transport of manure and bedding to the gasification unit.
Implementing solid separation systems to retain nutrients in the manure before processing.
Storing and handling wet cow manure prior to drying.
Maintaining the manure barn to prevent environmental hazards (e.g., E. coli, pathogens).
Complying with environmental regulations related to manure disposal and biochar use.
